newsitem.title: FINLAND: Silja says may break even in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Silja says may break even in 1997.

text.p: Finnish passenger ferry operator Silja Oy Ab repeated on Monday that it expected a clearly smaller loss in 1996 and said it may reach or exceed break-even in 1997.
"It is estimated that the group 1997 result may reach or exceed break-even," it said in its January-September interim report.

The group's main operation, baltic ferry operator Silja Line, would show a profit in 1996 and continue to improve earnings in 1997 but English channel ferry operator Sally's negative trend would continue at the end of the year and the beginning of next year, it said.
"The group will still be affected by Sally's losses during the first few months of 1997 and by continued high interest expenses," it said.
"The operating cash-flow will be positive," it added.
